de.esoco.ewt

Class EWT

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.esoco.ewt.EWT

  • public class EWT
extends java.lang.Object
    The main entry point into EWT. Contains only static methods that allow to acquire a user interface context or to manipulate global settings.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static GewtCss CSS
      The GEWT CSS (for package-internal use)
      static java.lang.String HIDDEN_URL_FRAME
      The name of the download frame in the root HTML of the current application.
      static boolean USE_LAYOUT_PANELS
      A global constant that defines whether the GEWT layout is based on the GWT LayoutPanel or the classic table-based GWT panels.

    • Method Detail

      • addCssClassMapping

        public static void addCssClassMapping(java.lang.String sApplicationCssClass,
                                      java.lang.String sTargetCssClass)
        Adds a mapping for a CSS class name. Applications can then use their own CSS class which will then automatically be translated into the respective target CSS class.
        Parameters:
        sApplicationCssClass - The CSS class used by the application
        sTargetCssClass - The CSS class to map the application class to

      • addCssClassMappings

        public static void addCssClassMappings(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> rMappings)
        Adds several CSS class mappings.
        Parameters:
        rMappings - The mappings to add
        See Also:
        addCssClassMapping(String, String)

      • convertToInnerHtml

        public static java.lang.String convertToInnerHtml(java.lang.String sHtml,
                                                  java.lang.String sBaseUrl)
        Converts an HTML string so that it can be used as the inner HTML of a widget. If the input is a complete HTML page this method then first extracts the content of the body tag. Then it converts all relative URL references with absolute URLs of the given base URL.
        Parameters:
        sHtml - The HTML to convert
        sBaseUrl - The base URL for the conversion of relative URLs
        Returns:
        The converted HTML string

      • copyTextToClipboard

        public static void copyTextToClipboard(java.lang.String sText)
        Places a text string in the system clipboard. This requires that the input focus is moved to a hidden component. As there is no reliable way to find the previously focused element it is recommended that invoking code resets the focus to the previously active input component after this method returns.
        Parameters:
        sText - The text string

      • createUserInterfaceContext

        public static UserInterfaceContext createUserInterfaceContext(Resource rResource)
        Creates a new user interface context.
        Parameters:
        rResource - The context resource or NULL for none
        Returns:
        A new user interface context instance

      • expandResource

        public static java.lang.String expandResource(Component rComponent,
                                              java.lang.String sResource)
        Expands a resource for a particular user interface component. Checks if a string starts with the character '$' and therefore represents a resource key. If so, the corresponding resource value will be returned after performing a lookup from the application resource. If the string argument is not prefixed and therefore not a resource key it will be returned unchanged.
        Parameters:
        rComponent - The Component to perform the resource lookup for
        sResource - The string to check and (if necessary) expand
        Returns:
        The resource string (NULL if no resource entry could be found)

      • getChildViewFactory

        public static ChildView.ChildViewFactory getChildViewFactory()
        Returns the factory for child view widgets.
        Returns:
        The child view factory

      • getDoubleClickInterval

        public static int getDoubleClickInterval()
        Returns the default interval for the detection of double clicks.
        Returns:
        The default double click interval

      • getLayoutFactory

        public static final LayoutFactory getLayoutFactory()
        Returns the current layout factory.
        Returns:
        The layout factory

      • getLayoutMapper

        public static final LayoutMapper getLayoutMapper()
        Returns the current layout mapper.
        Returns:
        The layout mapper

      • getWidgetFactory

        public static WidgetFactory<?> getWidgetFactory(java.lang.Class<? extends Component> rComponentClass)
        Returns the widget factory for a certain component or layout instance.
        Parameters:
        rComponentClass - The component class for which to return the factory for
        Returns:
        The widget factory or NULL if no factory has been registered
        See Also:
        registerWidgetFactory(Class, WidgetFactory, boolean)

      • log

        public static void log(java.lang.String sFormat,
                       java.lang.Object... rArgs)
        An enhanced GWT logging method that allows to use a (simple) format string and message arguments. Based on GWT.log(String) and TextConvert.format(String, java.util.Collection).
        Parameters:
        sFormat - The message format string
        rArgs - The message arguments

      • logTime

        public static void logTime(java.lang.String sInfo,
                           java.lang.String sName,
                           long nStart)
        Measures and logs the time of a profiled execution.
        Parameters:
        sInfo - An info string describing the profiling
        sName - The name of the profiled context
        nStart - The starting time of the measuring in milliseconds

      • logTime

        public static void logTime(java.lang.String sInfo,
                           java.lang.String sName,
                           long nStart,
                           int nThreshold)
        Measures and logs the time of a profiled execution if it exceeds a certain threshold.
        Parameters:
        sInfo - An info string describing the profiling
        sName - The name of the profiled context
        nStart - The starting time of the measuring in milliseconds
        nThreshold - The threshold in milliseconds

      • mapCssClass

        public static java.lang.String mapCssClass(java.lang.String sCssClass)
        Maps a certain CSS class name if a corresponding mapping has been registered through addCssClassMapping(String, String). If no mapping exists the input name will be returned unchanged.
        Parameters:
        sCssClass - The CSS class name to map
        Returns:
        The mapped CSS class name or the input name if no mapping exists

      • measure

        public static void measure(java.lang.String sDescription,
                           java.lang.Runnable rProfiledCode)
        A helper method that measures the execution time of a Runnable object.
        Parameters:
        sDescription - The description of the measured code
        rProfiledCode - The code to measure the execution time of

      • openHiddenUrl

        public static void openHiddenUrl(java.lang.String sRelativeUrl)
        Opens a URL that is relative to the current web application in an invisible frame. This can be used to initiate downloads.
        Parameters:
        sRelativeUrl - A URL that is relative to the current module's base URL

      • openUrl

        public static void openUrl(java.lang.String sUrl,
                           java.lang.String sName,
                           java.lang.String sFeatures)
        Opens a URL in a new browser window. If the URL is not starting with 'http' (i.e. is not absolute) the current module base URL will be prepended. The possible values for name and features are described here.
        Parameters:
        sUrl - The URL to open
        sName - The name of the new window or NULL for none
        sFeatures - The desired Features of the new windows or NULL for none

      • registerDefaultWidgetFactories

        public static void registerDefaultWidgetFactories(boolean bReplaceExisting)
        Registers all default GEWT widget factories.
        Parameters:
        bReplaceExisting - TRUE to replace existing mappings with the default factory, FALSE to keep current factories

      • registerWidgetFactory

        public static void registerWidgetFactory(java.lang.Class<? extends Component> rComponentClass,
                                         WidgetFactory<?> rFactory,
                                         boolean bReplaceExisting)
        Registers a widget factory for a certain component type.
        Parameters:
        rComponentClass - The type of component to register the factory for
        rFactory - The widget factory
        bReplaceExisting - TRUE to replace an existing mapping with the given factory, FALSE to keep the current factory
        See Also:
        getWidgetFactory(Class)

      • requestUrlContent

        public static void requestUrlContent(java.lang.String sUrl,
                                     java.util.function.BiConsumer<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> fProcessContent,
                                     java.util.function.Consumer<java.lang.Throwable> fHandleError)
        Executes an HTTP request that retrieves the content of the argument URL. If the URL is relative (i.e. doesn't start with 'http') it will be retrieved relative to the GWT base path for static resources.
        Parameters:
        sUrl - The URL to retrieve
        fProcessContent - a binary function that receives the retrieved URL content and the base URL of the content as it's argument
        fHandleError - A function that handles errors

      • setChildViewFactory

        public static void setChildViewFactory(ChildView.ChildViewFactory rFactory)
        Sets the child view factory to be used by the GEWT framework. This will override the default factory.
        Parameters:
        rFactory - The new child view factory

      • setLayoutFactory

        public static void setLayoutFactory(LayoutFactory rFactory)
        Sets a new layout factory. EWT extensions can set a factory to create their own layouts instead of the defaults.
        Parameters:
        rFactory - The new layout factory or NULL to reset to the default

      • setLayoutMapper

        public static void setLayoutMapper(LayoutMapper rMapper)
        Sets a new layout mapper. EWT extensions can use such a mapper to replace default layouts with their own instances.
        Parameters:
        rMapper - The new layout mapper or NULL to reset to the default
